docs.snippet: LEAD: The Guatemalan military provided assistance for several years to rebels trying to overthrow the Nicaraguan Government, despite public assertions of neutrality in the conflict, according to the Tower Commission report and officials familiar w...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The Guatemalan military provided assistance for several years to rebels trying to overthrow the Nicaraguan Government, despite public assertions of neutrality in the conflict, according to the Tower Commission report and officials familiar with the activities.

headline.main: Guatemala Aided Contras, Despite Denials, Panels Says

byline.original: By RICHARD J. MEISLIN, Special to the New York Times

docs.snippet: LEAD: President Oscar Arias Sanchez of Costa Rica said tonight that the Tower Commission report ''must be mistaken'' in saying that his country had been pressured by the United States to keep secret the existence of an airstrip used by Nicaraguan ...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: President Oscar Arias Sanchez of Costa Rica said tonight that the Tower Commission report ''must be mistaken'' in saying that his country had been pressured by the United States to keep secret the existence of an airstrip used by Nicaraguan rebels.

headline.main: Costa Rican Leader Denies Report of U.S. Pressure

byline.original: By LARRY ROHTER, Special to the New York Times

docs.snippet: LEAD: Even mainstream conservatives in Congress who have loyally supported Reagan aid to the contras have been stirred by the new Central American peace plan put forth by Costa Rica. Speaking for them is Robert Michel, the House minority leader, w...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Even mainstream conservatives in Congress who have loyally supported Reagan aid to the contras have been stirred by the new Central American peace plan put forth by Costa Rica. Speaking for them is Robert Michel, the House minority leader, who urges a two-point program on Mr. Reagan: First, announce a seven-month ''peace-plan moratorium'' before requesting an additional $100 million in aid for the Nicaraguan rebels.

headline.main: The Michel Plan for Central America

docs.snippet: LEAD: The Tower Commission report issued today provides a wealth of new data on the Iran-contra affair....
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The Tower Commission report issued today provides a wealth of new data on the Iran-contra affair.

headline.main: The Unfolding of a Secret White House Policy: A Clearer Picture Emerges

docs.snippet: LEAD: WHO could resist a tiny Middle Western town where the barber shop is called Rooster's and the game of basketball is foremost on every mind? Probably no one, and the quaintly innocent ''Hoosiers'' is irresistible in much the same way. This fi...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: WHO could resist a tiny Middle Western town where the barber shop is called Rooster's and the game of basketball is foremost on every mind? Probably no one, and the quaintly innocent ''Hoosiers'' is irresistible in much the same way. This film's very lack of surprise and sophistication accounts for a lot of its considerable charm.

headline.main: FILM: GENE HACKMAN AS A COACH IN 'HOOSIERS'

docs.snippet: LEAD: In its effort to organize private aid for the Nicaraguan rebels, the White House solicited help from - and by some accounts threatened - several countries heavily dependent on American financial and political support, the Tower Commission re...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: In its effort to organize private aid for the Nicaraguan rebels, the White House solicited help from - and by some accounts threatened - several countries heavily dependent on American financial and political support, the Tower Commission report disclosed today.

headline.main: THE WHITE HOUSE CRISIS: The Contras  INQUIRY FINDS REAGAN AND CHIEF ADVISERS RESPONSIBLE FOR 'CHAOS' IN IRAN ARMS DEALS  White House Cast Wide Net In Seeking Aid for Contras; A Web of Maneuvers

byline.original: By STEPHEN ENGELBERG, Special to the New York Times

docs.snippet: LEAD: WHEN the Academy Award nominations were announced recently, some New Yorkers were surprised, others indignant, and some even affronted. ''Hoosiers,'' which garnered two nominations - one for best musical score and another for Dennis Hopper a...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: WHEN the Academy Award nominations were announced recently, some New Yorkers were surprised, others indignant, and some even affronted. ''Hoosiers,'' which garnered two nominations - one for best musical score and another for Dennis Hopper as best supporting actor - had not yet even opened in New York.

docs.snippet: LEAD: When Richard Rodgers and Oscar Hammerstein 2d first envisioned a young woman singing, ''I'm as corny as Kansas in August'' and ''I'm as normal as blueberry pie,'' they knew exactly whom they were writing for. And as they expected, Mary Marti...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: When Richard Rodgers and Oscar Hammerstein 2d first envisioned a young woman singing, ''I'm as corny as Kansas in August'' and ''I'm as normal as blueberry pie,'' they knew exactly whom they were writing for. And as they expected, Mary Martin caused a sensation when ''South Pacific'' first opened in 1949.

headline.main: 'SOUTH PACIFIC' ATTRACTS A NEW GROUP OF NELLIES

docs.snippet: LEAD: Democrats and Republicans in Congress are both groping for strategies to fight the first skirmish in this year's battle over aid to the Nicaraguan insurgents....
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Democrats and Republicans in Congress are both groping for strategies to fight the first skirmish in this year's battle over aid to the Nicaraguan insurgents.

headline.main: Redrawing Battle Lines On Aid to the Contras

docs.snippet: LEAD: TONIGHT'S edition of ''The Barbara Walters Special'' -on ABC at 10 o'clock - is the 37th in a series of periodic celebrity interviews. Perhaps inevitably, even as Ms. Walters seems to become younger and more glamorous with each passing year,...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: TONIGHT'S edition of ''The Barbara Walters Special'' -on ABC at 10 o'clock - is the 37th in a series of periodic celebrity interviews. Perhaps inevitably, even as Ms. Walters seems to become younger and more glamorous with each passing year, even as the ratings remain strong, the format has gone soft in the center and dull around the edges.

headline.main: BETTE MIDLER ON BARBARA WALTERS SPECIAL
